ratings.comment: Professor Assadi is actually a really good professor and person. I happen to think his Math 141 class was one of the easiest I have taken. If you take the time to go to office hours, or even just introduce yourself to him, I believe a lot more will become cleared up. I even signed up for additional classes with.

This professor was here twice out of the entire semester. We had subs following his absences and they were just about as bad as teaching as he was. He spent an entire class talking about illnesses. The material itself is not difficult as long as you do the homework and look over the book (teach it yourself). I would recommend avoiding this class.

He is very inspirational, and very interested in his students and their success.  However, as a lecturer, he is not helpful as he takes several steps forward when most students need only one step.  Very advanced!

This is the easiest class, but at the same time a bit frustrating. If you just need a math credit, take this class! He is a very nice man but a little confusing. You only need the book for required homework. Grade wise if you do the revisions, and practices midterms you should get an A on the midterms. Show up to class most of the semester.

I  don't see what the problems are with Assadi. He cares more about his students than any other Professor I have ever had, he is very helpful if you attend his office hours. Granted, his lectures are disorganized and makes it very unclear, but just read through the book and it should be an easy A. He is very lenient on many things, just have to ask

Run. Run like hell from Assadi. He skips class and on the occasion he does show up, he's clueless as to what he's trying to teach. The material is easy to learn from the book, but don't expect any help understanding it from this guy. Straight up nuts.
Incompetent and disorganized. Lectures made very little sense. He posted solutions for midterms that were full of errors. Avoid.
Avoid this professor at all costs. Incredibly useless. You will do well in the class but won't learn a thing.

I understand why some students   dislike Prof. Assadi. Some material is not immediately pertinent, but is interesting if you have an appreciation for math. Tests are difficult, but there are never surprises. His jokes are corny but endearing. Despite being a big shot researcher, Assadi genuinely cares about the success of his students.
Engaging professor who is keen on research aspects of his lessons
He is a very nice man and I learned a lot from him and found  him to be very smart. He is very kind and really cares about his students.
Terrible, can't understand him, horrible

Avoid Assadi's 234 at all costs.  There are better professors for the course, and his lectures are completely useless. Having a good TA is crucial to success/getting anything out of the class.  Long-winded lectures are full of digressions - the lectures leave you more confused that you were walking in.  Find a different professor for 234.

Worst educational experience I have ever had. He basically comes to lecture and rambles about something related to the class. It's basically useless to go to lecture. The last day before the final he comes late, watches the TA do some problems then makes up some excuse and leaves. To sum it up avoid this guy at all costs.

To sum it up, this guy sucks. Lectures are impossible to follow because he has no train of though and can barely speak english. Grading scale sucks, scored the median on every exam including final and got a C. wtf? The fact that is guy is still allowed to teach here is a tribute to this university's complete lack of care for undergrad education.
His lectures are poorly prepared and nearly impossible to follow, the tests ranged from easy to hard. If you take him there is no point in even attending lecture.

Worst professor I've ever had, plain and simple. I didn't learn  anything in lecture or discussion for that matter (my TA was awful too). I stopped going about three weeks into the semester. The book is your only hope for passing this class.

Pretty much learned nothing from him. Everything is all theory in the lectures. Very rarely are there any examples with numbers. It became pointless to come to lectures because I could learn better from the book.

He is very nice, but he can't teach. He spends the entire lecture doing problems that are hard and that don't pertain to anything. You also end up correcting his endless mistakes. I learned from the book, and I got an A only because the old exams are like the exams in class. If you want to learn the material I would suggest you take another prof.

If you want to succeed in Assadi's class, study out of the book instead of going to lecture. His lectures are worthless and the few that I have gone to I have come out of knowing less about math. Like almost everyone else has said, he is a nice guy with good intentions. He just can't teach to save his life.

What to say about Amir Assadi...if you want to learn anything about calculus don't go to lecture. If you would like to hear some entertaining stories that have absolutely no relevance to math whatsoever, then feel free to attend. Like many others have said, he is a nice guy but can't teach.
Couldn't learn anything from him. I went to every lecture but it really was useless. He is nice but cannot teach.

Lectures are useless although they did get a little better as the year went on. Practice exams are a lot like midterms but if you don't know a couple of the problems your grade goes down dramatically.  Final was nothing like practice exam. I learned NOTHING in his class and still got a B.

He's a nice professor but he cannot teach.  I taught myself out of the book, went to Borisov's lecture, and depended heavily on my TA who could actually teach.  Exams are easy and essentially the same as the practice exam given the day before.  An A on the final equals an A in the class which is what happened to me.

I entered this class as an econ student, hoping to complete the honors degree. I've been an AB/B student in the previous two calculus classes. This class, however, was ridiculously hard. Lecture was useless, midterms were okay but final looked nothing like practice exam. Be prepared to work to understand the material.

No good. He doesnt know how to lead a lecture, but i can barely tell what his lecture is about considering half the time is spent correcting his silly yet constant mistakes. I stopped attending his lectures early on (as recommended by one of the TAs) and regretted ever going back to "check in." What a terrible way to end my math experience.

Assadi's heart is in the right place but he just doesn't know how to effectively teach a lecture.  He is disorganized, sometimes late, and his notes are messt and go all over the place. He definitely knows his stuff but has a hard time conveying the essence. Book is the only way to learn how to solve problems.  Luckily his tests are pretty easy.

A very charismatic teacher but did not teach very well.  Led by difficult examples and would tell you how to solve the problem after you had 10 minutes to work on it with no previous knowledge of how to solve them.  His style is very confusing but he is passionate about what he teaches.  Only for those who don't need step by step instructions.

the worst calculus professor ever. he might thought his lecture is inspiring, well, some of his points may be intriguing. But not at all helpful in getting down to the beef - the questions! the solid math! If you are someone who want to learn something handful and practical, never take his course, it'll be lots of pain to figure what he want to say

Lectures were somewhat hard to follow and to a point, useless. 2nd exam and final were based closely on practice exams, but I think this was based on his TAs. If you got an A on the final, you got an A in the class. Im not sure if he had ever done that before.

Lectures are pointless, he is hard to understand and rambles on about things we will never need to know.  I'm not sure why I took notes in lecture, but I never looked at my notes again once I walked out the door.  Tests are easy enough if you study the practice exams...the actual test will have almost exactly the same problems as the practice one.

He's a nice guy, but he's not very good at lecturing.  The first exam was really easy, the second was impossible, and the final was appropriate.  After the second week, most of us started going to Bob Wilson's lecture which was the hour before.
Tends to teach everything extremely in depth and in mathematical generalizations far beyond what is necessary to comprehend the material.
He is absolutely useless...The tests are really easy but there is just no point to go to the lectures...

If you are happy learning from a book, this class is for you. Lectures truly are useless - you will never see the stuff he puts on the board again. Test are easy if you do all the webwork and study the book since they are straight from the examples and pretest.

Listen to me very carefully do not even think about picking a class where this guy is the prof. Lectures are pointless, so you try and teach yourself through the book. But that doesn't matter because come test time, his questions take up half a page and are impossible to translate into math terms.

Worst professor I've had. Doesn't teach anything concrete, uses the most random examples that make no sense to anyone and are impossible to follow. Even if you know everything from the book it doesn't matter because he writes his tests so they don't even relate to what is being covered. Gives not nearly enough time for exams and is overall horrible

Warning! Very very hard tests!! Also tests are extremely long! Lecture is hard to learn in. He seems to try hard, and seems to care about our learning, but it just doesn't come across I think. Needs to use more conrete examples before writing general equations and proofs up. Is pretty decent administratively so you will be fine with a good TA.

Lecture is useless,except when he doesn't show up and the TA's give a review.  He is disorganized, and doesn't even talk about what we are learning.Tests are hard and too long.Class is twice as bad if you have a bad TA.  His grading policy is also inconsistent and unclear and can easily screw you, it did me on the final.  Take someone else.
I got an A, but I still don't know if I learned anything.  He comes up with crazy stories that have nothing to do with math.  Take someone else if you can
Maybe a nice guy, but a terrible professor. Class is almost pointless unless its a rare day where he does examples.
It is almost useless to go to lecture just stay home and go through the book on your own. Would not recommend him at all.

Lectures are truly useless. Tests come straight from examples given the lecture before the test and practice tests that he has the TAs send out. Homework isn't terrible, it just isn't particularly helpful on the tests, which do not test on if you actually learned the material in the class or the textbook.

absolutely terrible. lectures are completely useless unless you are an absolute math whiz. hands down the worst run class from top to bottom (TAs included) ive had since going here. grading curve is pretty generous however, u may be able to get a good grade but dont plan on learning anything while ur in his calc 3 class

He's a nice guy and can be funny at times, but an awful teacher. You won't follow a thing he does in lecture; he pretty much told us in the beginning that nothing he does in lecture would be on an exam. The only reason I got an A was because of our awesome TA Sabrina, and the fact that SHE made up the exams, not him. Avoid Assadi.

This is the worst professor I have ever had. He is unclear in a way I didnt think was possible. He writes all over the place and nothing he says makes any sense. The notes in class are mostly proofs and are not tested so read the book, skip class and go to discussion...The TA I had was amazing so try to luck out there.

his lectures are usually a waste of time unless he has the class try examples.. he is hard to follow and seems  pretty unorganized - i learned everything from the book and TA.. altho he is fair and can be entertaining - he promised drinks to people who corrected his mistakes in class, and so at the end he threw a keg party in van vleck lol

There was not a numerical example preformed in class until over half way through the semester!!! Lectures did not cover material that was similar to the book and his teaching style is all over the place.

Lecture is a race to get everything on the board for the first 15 minutes.  Then you get mad and leave.  Skipped class for two months and had no trouble learning from the book. Just make sure you know when the exams are.  I'd recomment Wilson.

I'm in this class right now and  I don't know why I keep going to lectures.  All the learning comes from the TA and the textbook.  He rambles, what he puts up on the board is way out there (I get it, but it's stuff we don't even need to know, trust me, all theory and stuff.) Take another Prof. if you can, Wilson is probably the best.
Doesnt teach anything
Most of the learning for the exams comes from the TA and the textbook.
No Comments
No Comments

Sat through three lectures before switching professors.  Forget the accent, the way this guy's mind wanders and what he chooses to put on the board, it's impossible to take any intelligible notes.  Students give up and leave like clockwork.

boring.  one midterm and the final.  homework is graded.  assigns a lot of homework.  gets off topic and the lectures are sometimes hard to follow.  it takes a little while to get used to his english as well.
No Comments

This guy is awful.  He gets paid to teach a graduate-level class and then turns around and has a RA do all the lecturing.  And when he does actually decide to lecture, it's just painful to sit through.  I doubt he spent more than a few hours all semester on the class.  Why the math department even pays this guy is beyond me.
No Comments
Assadi is not to be trusted.  He is very two-faced and paranoid.  He is friendly to only those who agree with his opinions completely and has no respect for dissenting views.
